item.title: Chinese firms use obscure legal tactics to stem virus losses
item.description: Chinese firms use obscure legal tactics to stem virus losses obscure 鲜为人知的 tactic [usually pl.] 策略，手段 stem : to stop sth that is flowing from spreading or increasing 阻止，封堵 “It is going to be an almighty legal mess for months and years to come.” That grim prognosis of the potential legal and business consequences of the viral outbreak in China comes from a veteran of the country's business scene.

item.title: Italy faces a sudden surge in covid-19 cases
item.description: Italy faces a sudden surge in covid-19 cases surge： With disconcerting suddenness, Italy has found itself the European country worst affected by covid-19. By February 23rd the number of people infected with the coronavirus that first emerged in the Chinese city of Wuhan had leapt to 152, jump of around 100 within a day. Three of them all in their late 60s or older, have already died. Italy now has the third-most cases in the world, after China itself, where 77,000 have been infected, and South Korea, where the total has surged to more than 600.
